intro: Rubroshorea mecistopteryx, commonly known as the red-veined flamebush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking red and green foliage, with leaves that have prominent veins giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
